learning_outcomes.description: embark on inquiry and determine a need for knowledge and understanding
find/generate new information/data using appropriate methodology
critically evaluate the information/data generated and the processes to ﬁnd or generate the information/data
synthesize, analyse and critically consider the new knowledge generated, and where applicable, proposes solutions for the identified health issue
communicate the knowledge and the processes used to generate it, in a logical and coherent structure, using a high standard of scientific English writing.
know how to acknowledge all sources of information and adhere to scholarly citation conventions
write a manuscript/professional report that meets academic standards for dissemination or publication in the scientific literature
work effectively in a health-related work environment
demonstrate skills in effective oral communication

assessments.task_description:
A critical part of your early work in PUBH7955 has been to review the literature pertaining to your dissertation topic. As part of this research, you are required to identify the gap that your dissertation will address and how you plan to address it (aims and methods).



This task requires you to prepare and deliver a research pitch.  This pitch will be a short presentation of the literature and gap you have identified along with a clear justification as to why your research should be undertaken and propose methods for your study that addresses the identified gap.



The research pitch will be presented via video and should be supported with visual aids, such as PowerPoint. The pitch should take no longer than 7 minutes.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Supervisors will assess capability of student (based on interactions throughout the semester) with a focus on 1) content knowledge; 2) professionalism and research integrity and 3) collaborative practice.



Note: this will be completed and submitted by your supervisor in collaboration with the course coordinator.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
